byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez contributed reporting from Hixson, Tenn.

abstract: Armed civilians have begun showing up to guard military recruitment centers across United States following attack on military facility in Chattanooga, Tenn; many say they will continue until officers at centers are themselves armed; military officials politely discourage trend, expressing concern that armed presence will discourage people from entering centers to enlist.
lead_paragraph: Armed citizens are intent on beefing up security at recruitment centers after the fatal shootings in Tennessee. But the help, if well intentioned, is raising questions and concerns.

headline.main: Armed and Determined, Civilians Look to Prevent Another Chattanooga
headline.print_headline: Civilians Look to Prevent a Repeat of Chattanooga

snippet: Armed citizens are intent on beefing up security at recruitment centers after the fatal shootings in Tennessee. But the help, if well intentioned, is raising questions and concerns.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
